meta.description: Premier Lounge at Ngurah Rai International Airport (DPS), International Terminal. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Premier Lounge

location.terminalDirections: After Passport Control, proceed through the Duty Free Area, take the lift up to the Mezzanine Level entrance.

lounge.description: Escape the noise and chaos of the terminal and enjoy the ultimate getaway before your departure. Delight in a host of luxurious amenities at the Premier Lounge, including a premium buffet, complimentary Wi-Fi, and refreshing shower facilities.

general: Children under 2 years old are admitted free with an adult.
International telephone calls require an additional cost.
Reflexology therapy is available at an additional cost.
regulatory: This lounge is only accessible for passengers departing on international flights.

reviews.content: Small and busy, same as Concordia, but better food and has alcohol to numb the pain of overcrowding. Top tip - head outside to find extra seating
Junk lounge. Would recommend the other lounge if you have Priority Pass.
Spacious and comfortable. Food offering a little underwhelming, but it’s nice to have access to air conditioning and a clean shower.
Good food selection, has an aircon, not super effective but better than being outside.
Was denied entry to this lounge stating that they reserve the right to refuse entry due to capacity for Priority Pass holders. Lounge was half empty. Priority Pass privileges keep getting slimmer.
If LoungeBuddy had five stars to choose from I would have given 3/5. It is a comfortable enough lounge with reasonable food options. The aircon was not good and the only wine available was foul.
Spacious lounge in a small airport. Has decent food options if you’re hungry or want to munch. Also, have the primary liquor and wine. Internet is spotty sometimes.
T/G lounge is better. Older facilities.
Limited wine, not mentioned on booking info. When manager approach he indicated an airline request. But beer is not limited. Food & amenities poor. Would I do it again - definitely NOT.
Sad and old looking. Food selection looks sad. Decor looks sad. Everything feels dated.
Might have improved. Still gets crowded. Lots of food options. Has decent wifi. Good number of electrical outlets.
Uncomfortable, bad coffee & food, strange & unsettling music playing. All in all would have preferred to wait at the gate.
Better than gate lounge but very simple offering. T/G lounge next door looks much nicer and less crowded. Little food and only dry white wine, limited spirits or soft drink on offer.
Nothing fancy but does the trick if you need to plug and have a drink.
Average lounge. Internet slow and washrooms are old.
Lounge has always a decent selection of local dishes, comfortable leather chairs, clean, good service, and not crowded.  Downside: more outlets, replace bathroom tile, weak internet and warmer food.
Very disappointed. Chose this lounge by the rating in LoungeBuddy. This is NOT a fresh category lounge. Old & dirty seating, only 1 shower which is very old & I had to seek out staff to get a towel.
Rudely turned away with Priority Pass because we weren’t business class passengers.
I was refused entry. The gentleman claimed it was full. A man and daughters walked up and they were allowed in using a Priority Pass for which I got denied entry. Just an FYI, I am a Black Man!
Too many airlines use this small lounge resulting in a crowded and noisy environment, visited multiple times and always the same. If you can, go to the T/G lounge next door instead.
Lounge is OK for short stay. Limited food option, drinks too. It’s overrated lounge. I ordered omelette and it was OK.

Not very premium unfortunately but more comfortable than gate lounge. Far too crowded/small for volume of flight that use it. Many noisy kids. Single shower for each gender. Small unappealing food range.
We visited at 9am. Very quiet, and a reasonable breakfast spread. Chicken roll, vegetable samosa, soup, chicken black pepper sauce, omelettes, toast, fruit, and salad.
Not worth the time if you can avoid it.
It’s pretty, but it’s crowded, the WiFi is terrible, the food is bad and stodgy, and it’s always full of noisy children running riot. I left to spend time in the terminal, it was really that bad.
Ew. Not very clean, overcrowded, and food scares me. Chose to go to food court instead.
We were flying Business Class with Emirates Airlines 24th March 2018. Extremely disappointed. Substandard dirty. Poor quality of food. Toilets disgusting.
This lounge might vary by time of day you come. I'm here at noon and it has a huge food + drink selection. It's clean and has great service. I saw some reviews in peak/low hours that weren't great.
Pretty filthy. Food at 10:00 was well and truly past its best. Left and went to the food court. At least it was cleaner there.

Sitting here at 5:45am - nobody is really here, and there’s still no food. Buddy just took last piece of toast, two pieces of pineapple left. Place is dingy, dated, and dirty. Leaving to get a coffee.
Been here a few times and it gets worse every visit. The drinks are warm, there are no seats, the lounge is packed. And the food isn't good.
The staff tries but maybe 20 airlines use it for their lounge so it’s packed, dirty, and worn. Most of the food was empty and drinks were warm. Have to stand around like seagulls waiting for a seat.
More relaxing in here than being at the gate. Food quality could be better. Also should be hot. One good thing I came past the time of expiry which wasn’t a issue. This I liked.
A better place to wait than any other at this busy airport. Even if it’s crowded as well, not perfect clean, the food basic and the staff not very attending. On the other hand the price is fair.
Comfortable lounge. Although it has been a little bit crowdy there was enough space for everyone. Fresh food, good variety of non-alcoholic drinks, varieties of coffee and tea. Worth it.

Comfortable lounge, spacious, very quiet, free food and drink, friendly staff but you have to catch their eye! Could do with a refurb but very calm and quiet before a long journey. Worth it for price.
Tired and run down with poor grumpy service. Drinks warm, and wifi slow. Needs a good clean - especially the shower and front desk manager far from welcoming.
Furniture needs refurbishment, food range not good, same as last year! Air condition not strong enough.
The showers are substandard and seating is very limited.
Poor slow WiFi, small cockroaches in the toilet & average food.
Adequate service and fairly spacious but lousy food. Had to fight off flies and a baby cockroach while I ate. Rips in the furniture.
A bit dated and food choices not that great, although they were replenished quite frequently with new choices. Fridge was barely cold so all drinks were warm. Air con was freezing in some areas.
Great lounge inside a small airport. Food spread was nice, drink selection is adequate. Service was good. Better than most US domestic lounges.
As others stated. Crowded but satisfactory for a quick bite and some drinks.
Nice lounge with good food options and nice seating. Can get slightly crowded but this lounge is better than expected based on previous reviews.
Feels crowded in the early evening but staff is all smiles. Some OK food and drink options, nothing special. A bit warm but still cooler than in the terminal.
The lounge was quiet and has a reading room and computer room. Good buffet. You have the option of sitting in air conditioning area or non-air conditioning overlooking the shops.
Showers are dirty and small cockroaches in the bathroom. The facility itself needs upkeep and clean bathrooms. Wifi on and off. Food is decent.
Small but comfortable lounge. Decent food selection, horrible WiFi... Constant drops and slow.
Lounge is not bad at all. AC cooler than airport and decent food selection. Chicken noodle soup, noodles, rice. Desserts and fruit. Better than waiting at gate. Also beer, juices, and tea.
Rejected using Priority Pass as lounge too busy.
Decent selection of Asian food and various drinks. Can get crowded with families but it's generally large enough so you can find a quiet corner.
Lounge looks nice enough. Food and drink are basic. A/C is cooler in the lounge than in hot airport.
Lounge is pretty good. Good space, nice buffet of food and selection of drinks. Wifi is lacking. Famous Balinese service.
Really enjoyed this lounge. Was a bit skeptical going here after reviews but now that I came here, it's really nice. It's clean and there is a lot of space and food is fresh.
Pretty lousy lounge. Always busy. Food option limited and not very tasty. Beats sitting at the gate tho.
Dirty old chairs, dirty floors, very average food.
Cool drink, nice enough food, but the photos make it look better than it is. Lounges are old and dirty :(
About what you'd expect out of DPS. A bit crowded, darkly lit, and unsatisfying food options. But better than waiting at the gate.
Previously in DPS when the current lounge was under construction. New lounge opened and a vast improvement. Ample seating, varied food selection, cans of beer and soda, etc. Quite nice & enjoyable.
The shower is unusable. No towels, shampoo or soap available when requested. It's very busy and a bit loud in the mid afternoon.
Pretty small, has shower but when asked for towel all they could give me was what looked like dirty bath mats.
Bathrooms dirty, small but nice and comfortable. Lots of snack choices. Showers without towels.
Wifi is unusable. Food is OK, plenty of seating.
Nice food options. Service was meh. Shower was satisfactory after a day sweating in the Bali heat. Spa services were a nice touch.
The lounge is good in terms of space, food variety and service but the only bad comment is on terrible wifi connection.
Horrible wifi, mediocre food. Screaming kids and shouting tourists. No quiet.
Nice breakfast selection. We saw tons of baby cockroaches around the food trays. It was not bad to eat the food since food was covered, but only a matter of time before it shows up in the food.

Slow Wi-Fi, shared with too many airlines, very average food, small drink range,
no smoking area. Great customer service though.

This lounge is much better than its predecessor. Plenty of space (late night), food selection not huge but sufficient. Only 1 bottle of wine behind the counter. Was very warm but was already rep to mgt.
Very average lounge that gets busy. Only red/white wine is served (upon request) - no visible liquor. Pasta can also be requested from the staff.
Ok - fulfills the need. But nothing special -
It's ok (that sums it up). Big, but busy. Small snacks and plenty of drinks available. Hygiene in restrooms sub standard, otherwise totally fine for a quick stop over.
I think this lounge is pretty good. Nice food for such a small lounge. Better than many in Europe. Clean. Not too crowded. And if the wifi is slow, use the public. Worked good for me.
Nice. Food is fair but as a carnivore was a bit disappointed in the chicken wings as only protein. Wine & beer available at the bar (some spirits as well it seems) where you can also order Carbonara.

It did the job - just.
Unclear how to get alcoholic drinks & became very, very busy hence not so relaxing.
Attractively styled but seats not very comfy and VERY crowded so we couldn't sit our family together. Some private areas, workstations, and contrary to an earlier review there IS a shower.
A great lounge with a good variety of food (multiple protein items) as well as spaghetti carbonara available to be cooked in front of you at the bar. Worth a stay!
Given that it is shared with many airlines, it's very busy. Average quality food.
Good variety of food, which unfortunately lacks quality. Wine has to be ordered from the bar. Wifi did not work properly. Given that this is one of the few lounges, can get very crowded.
Plenty of room, food ok, bar service efficient, wifi just satisfactory.
Good quality of food, a lot of spaces, very clean and comfortable.
One of the only lounges at Denpasar, so it's a bit crowded. Decent food selection but quality is hit and miss. No visible alcohol though others said wine is available.
Very poor and tasteless food... Very crowded ...
One of the better free non airline lounges I've seen. Mediocre food but clean, we'll maintained, and comfortable.
Poor wifi, poor food choices and only wine...
Although small, space is used well. Food is fresh and tasty. Staff attentive while barely being noticeable. As long as you don't need a shower, a fine lounge.
Beaucoup de monde dans ce salon. Il semblerait que tout le monde peut y accéder ce qui implique qu'il y à rarement à manger.

location.terminalDirections: International Departures. After Immigration, take the lift or stairs to the 3rd Floor and the lounge is located on the left hand side.
